result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:36pm
INCLUDES 14CF615, 14CM1298, 14CM2142, 16CF136
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Rick Cveykus.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to:
14CF615:
Ct. 1 Substantial Battery- intend bodily harm- repeater- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- repeater- domestic abuse >> D&RI
14CM1298:
Ct. 1 Battery- repeater- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Criminal Damage to Property- repeater- domestic abuse >> D&RI
16CF136:
Ct. 1 Resist Officer- Substantial Bodily Harm/soft tissue injury- repeater to DELETE "repeater" enhancer
Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA:
14CM1298:
Ct. 3 Disorderly Conduct- repeater- domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST
14CM2142:
Ct. 1 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater >> NO CONTEST
16CF136:
AMENDED Ct. 1 Resist Officer- Substantial Bodily Harm/soft tissue injury >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: On 14CM1298 Ct. 3 & 14CM2142 Ct. 1: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES, concurrent to each other and 16CF136 Ct. 1 and any other sentencing currently on. On 16CF136 Ct. 1: 4 and half years WSPS- 1 and half years IC, 3 years ES, concurrent to 14CM1298 Ct. 3 & 14CM2142 Ct. 1 and any other sentencing currently on. CONDITIONS OF ES: Complete Batter's treatment. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. Pay CC. No restitution requested. 201 days credit granted towards sentencing. Deft is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Programming and NOT for Substance Abuse Programming.
